explanation: metal_log: metal_virt2phys calls metal_log for error reporting. To determine whether any string comparisons in this call chain use memcmp on null-terminated strings, the implementation of metal_log must be inspected. strerror: metal_virt2phys calls strerror(errno) and the returned C string could be compared elsewhere; inspect strerror implementation (or wrappers) to ensure it does not internally use memcmp to compare null-terminated strings in a way that violates the rule. pread: metal_virt2phys calls pread; while unlikely to perform string comparisons, its implementation (or project-specific wrapper) should be checked in case it calls memcmp on null-terminated strings. memcmp: include the standard memcmp symbol itself so the analyzer can detect any direct or indirect uses of memcmp within metal_virt2phys or its callees (metal_log, strerror, pread) and determine whether those uses compare null-terminated strings (which would violate the MISRA rule).
